contentrichtext.text: {{primarysources|date=August 2009}} {{Infobox Radio station | name = XHRTA-FM | image = | city = [[Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes]], [[Mexico]] | area = [[Aguascalientes]] | branding = Aguascalientes FM | slogan = | airdate = | frequency = 92.7 MHz | format = Jazz, Rock | power = 90,000 w | erp = | class = | callsign_meaning = '''R'''adio y '''T'''elevisión de '''A'''guascalientes | former_callsigns = | owner = Radio y Televisión de Aguascalientes | webcast = | website = www.aguascalientes.gob.mx | affiliations = }} '''XHRTA-FM''' is a regional [[Mexico|Mexican]] [[radio station]] that serves the state of [[Aguascalientes]] and is owned by the Government of Aguascalientes through a division called Radio y Televisión de Aguascalientes. This station began broadcasting during the government of Felipe Gonzalez Gonzalez, and its format was more oriented to old Spanish music. Since the beginning of the government of [[Luis Armando Reynoso Femat]], 92.7 FM began airing more jazz programming. <br clear=all> {{Aguascalientes Radio}} {{coord missing|Mexico}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Xhrta-Fm}} [[Category:Regional Mexican radio stations]] [[Category:Spanish-language radio stations]] [[Category:Radio stations in Aguascalientes]] [[Category:Media in Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes]] {{Mexico-radio-station-stub}}
